verses.verse: Boast not <S%H408>thyself<s%> <S%H1984><s%> of <S%H3117>tomorrow;<s%> <S%H4279><s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> thou <S%H3045>knowest<s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H4100>what<s%> a <S%H3117>day<s%> may bring <S%H3205>forth.<s%>
Let another <S%H2114>man<s%> <S%H1984>praise<s%> thee, and <S%H3808>not<s%> thine own <S%H6310>mouth;<s%> a <S%H5237>stranger,<s%> and <S%H408>not<s%> thine own <S%H8193>lips.<s%>

A <S%H68>stone<s%> is <S%H3514>heavy,<s%> and the <S%H2344>sand<s%> <S%H5192>weighty;<s%> but a <S%H191>fool's<s%> <S%H3708>wrath<s%> is <S%H3515>heavier<s%> than them <S%H4480>both.<s%> <S%H8147><s%>
Wrath <S%H2534><s%> is <S%H395>cruel,<s%> and <S%H639>anger<s%> is <S%H7858>outrageous;<s%> but <S%H4310>who<s%> is able to <S%H5975>stand<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H7068>envy?<s%>
Open <S%H1540><s%> <S%H8433>rebuke<s%> is <S%H2896>better<s%> than <S%H5641>secret<s%> <S%H4480>love.<s%> <S%H160><s%>
Faithful <S%H539><s%> are the <S%H6482>wounds<s%> of a <S%H157>friend;<s%> but the <S%H5390>kisses<s%> of an <S%H8130>enemy<s%> are <S%H6280>deceitful.<s%>

The <S%H7649>full<s%> <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H947>loatheth<s%> a <S%H5317>honeycomb;<s%> but to the <S%H7457>hungry<s%> <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H3605>every<s%> bitter <S%H4751>thing<s%> is <S%H4966>sweet.<s%>
As a <S%H6833>bird<s%> that <S%H5074>wandereth<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> her <S%H7064>nest,<s%> <S%H3651>so<s%> is a <S%H376>man<s%> that <S%H5074>wandereth<s%> from his <S%H4480>place.<s%> <S%H4725><s%>

Ointment <S%H8081><s%> and <S%H7004>perfume<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> the <S%H3820>heart:<s%> so doth the <S%H4986>sweetness<s%> of a man's <S%H7453>friend<s%> by hearty <S%H4480>counsel.<s%> <S%H6098><s%> <S%H5315><s%>

Thine own <S%H7453>friend,<s%> and thy <S%H1>father's<s%> <S%H7453>friend,<s%> <S%H5800>forsake<s%> <S%H408>not;<s%> <S%H408>neither<s%> <S%H935>go<s%> into thy <S%H251>brother's<s%> <S%H1004>house<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of thy <S%H343>calamity:<s%> for <S%H2896>better<s%> is a <S%H7934>neighbor<s%> that is <S%H7138>near<s%> than a <S%H4480>brother<s%> <S%H251><s%> far <S%H7350>off.<s%>
My <S%H1121>son,<s%> be <S%H2449>wise,<s%> and make my <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H8055>glad,<s%> that I may <S%H7725>answer<s%> <S%H1697><s%> him that <S%H2778>reproacheth<s%> me.
A <S%H6175>prudent<s%> man <S%H7200>foreseeth<s%> the <S%H7451>evil,<s%> and hideth <S%H5641>himself;<s%> but the <S%H6612>simple<s%> pass <S%H5674>on,<s%> and are <S%H6064>punished.<s%>
Take <S%H3947><s%> his <S%H899>garment<s%> <S%H3588>that<s%> is <S%H6148>surety<s%> for a <S%H2114>stranger,<s%> and take a <S%H2254>pledge<s%> of him <S%H1157>for<s%> a strange <S%H5237>woman.<s%>

He that <S%H1288>blesseth<s%> his <S%H7453>friend<s%> with a <S%H1419>loud<s%> <S%H6963>voice,<s%> rising <S%H7925>early<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning,<s%> it shall be <S%H2803>counted<s%> a <S%H7045>curse<s%> to him.
A <S%H2956>continual<s%> <S%H1812>dropping<s%> in a very <S%H5464>rainy<s%> <S%H3117>day<s%> and a <S%H4079>contentious<s%> <S%H802>woman<s%> are <S%H7737>alike.<s%>
Whosoever <S%H6845>hideth<s%> her <S%H6845>hideth<s%> the <S%H7307>wind,<s%> and the <S%H8081>ointment<s%> of his right <S%H3225>hand,<s%> which <S%H7121>betrayeth<s%> itself.
Iron <S%H1270><s%> <S%H2300>sharpeneth<s%> <S%H1270>iron;<s%> so a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H2300>sharpeneth<s%> the <S%H6440>countenance<s%> of his <S%H7453>friend.<s%>
Whoso <S%H5341>keepeth<s%> the fig <S%H8384>tree<s%> shall <S%H398>eat<s%> the <S%H6529>fruit<s%> thereof: so he that <S%H8104>waiteth<s%> on his <S%H113>master<s%> shall be <S%H3513>honored.<s%>
As in <S%H4325>water<s%> <S%H6440>face<s%> answereth to <S%H6440>face,<s%> <S%H3651>so<s%> the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> to <S%H120>man.<s%>
Hell <S%H7585><s%> and <S%H10>destruction<s%> are <S%H3808>never<s%> <S%H7646>full;<s%> so the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> are <S%H3808>never<s%> <S%H7646>satisfied.<s%>
As the refining <S%H4715>pot<s%> for <S%H3701>silver,<s%> and the <S%H3564>furnace<s%> for <S%H2091>gold;<s%> so is a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H6310>to<s%> his <S%H4110>praise.<s%>

Though <S%H518><s%> thou shouldest <S%H3806>bray<s%> <S%H853><s%> a <S%H191>fool<s%> in a <S%H4388>mortar<s%> <S%H8432>among<s%> <S%H7383>wheat<s%> with a <S%H5940>pestle,<s%> yet will <S%H3808>not<s%> his <S%H200>foolishness<s%> <S%H5493>depart<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> <S%H5921><s%> him.
Be thou diligent to <S%H3045>know<s%> <S%H3045><s%> the <S%H6440>state<s%> of thy <S%H6629>flocks,<s%> and <S%H7896>look<s%> <S%H3820><s%> well to thy <S%H5739>herds.<s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> <S%H2633>riches<s%> are <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H5769>forever:<s%> and <S%H518>doth<s%> the <S%H5145>crown<s%> endure to every <S%H1755>generation?<s%> <S%H1755><s%>
The <S%H2682>hay<s%> <S%H1540>appeareth,<s%> and the tender <S%H1877>grass<s%> showeth <S%H7200>itself,<s%> and <S%H6212>herbs<s%> of the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> are <S%H622>gathered.<s%>
The <S%H3532>lambs<s%> are for thy <S%H3830>clothing,<s%> and the <S%H6260>goats<s%> are the <S%H4242>price<s%> of the <S%H7704>field.<s%>

And thou shalt have <S%H5795>goats'<s%> <S%H2461>milk<s%> <S%H1767>enough<s%> for thy <S%H3899>food,<s%> for the <S%H3899>food<s%> of thy <S%H1004>household,<s%> and for the <S%H2416>maintenance<s%> for thy <S%H5291>maidens.<s%>
